TopicTitle: [?.?.? - 1.12.x] Naztheme: An Alternate Theme for KSP

Articles.Content:
Naztheme


 

I recently discovered HUDReplacer (by @UltraJohn) which allows to change internal images in KSP, including almost all UI elements. So I'm currently creating my own theme, and since some of you may be interested in obtaining it, well... now you can obtain it
 

 

Installation

  1. Install HUDReplacer if you haven't installed it yet
  2. Download either the .zip or the .tar.gz file (not the source code!), unzip it, you should find a directory named Naztheme.
  3. Copy the directory into GameData. Please do not put it in another directory, as if you do HUDReplacer won't load the images (unless you change the config).
  4. Launch the game and enjoy!

 

Dependencies

Requires HUDReplacer and ModuleManager.

 

Download

   

License (apparently it's needed)

GNU GPL 2.0 or later

 

Changelog

Spoiler

Naztheme 0.3d

  • Added statemaps for AG buttons (complete)
  • Modified the altimeter's display to be more pleasing (tell me if you have any ideas for it)


Naztheme 0.3c

  • Added background in the Tracking Station
  • Added elements for the flight UI (mainly the time quadrant and the altimeter)

 

Naztheme 0.3b

  • Made the Navball rounder.
  • Removed the silly purple-and-black water textures I accidentally left by accident.
  • Made dropdown_test a bit more transparent for consistency with PAW background.


Naztheme 0.3a

  • Added (completed) missing UI elements for:
    • Tooltips
    • Navball! (except for SAS side icons and maneuver node stuff)
    • The thing below staging in flight ("staging quadrant")
    • Administration Building
    • Settings
    • Color picker (for fireworks)
    • "Play mission" dialog from MH (subject to Dynamic-Loading Issue)
    • Loading widget (bottom right, when changing scenes)
  • Restored the previous state of app_divider_pulldown_head_over (too dark)
  • Added some elements in Tracking Station (unfinished)
  • Added a texture for the background of resources bars (in flight, "resources" tab)
  • Added background and buttons for kbButtons (knowledge base, TS or mapview)


Naztheme 0.2c

  • Added missing elements for subassemblies.
  • Added KAL editor elements (KAL editor is complete now).
  • Completed Kerbnet access window.
  • Tweaked app_divider_pulldown_head_over (the orange bar above PAWs) so that it appears darker and less orange. (if you don't like it, tell me and I'll restore its previous state)


Naztheme 0.2b

  • Added the missing UI elements for the construction thing of the VAB (place, offset, rotate, re-root...). AG not done yet.
  • Fixed ugliness of per-stage Dv display in-flight.


Naztheme 0.2a

  • Added UI elements for:
    • Astronaut Complex (complete)
    • VAB (complete, except for a few buttons and AG)
    • Launchpad/Runway dialog (complete)
    • Staging (complete)


Naztheme 0.1b

  • Fixed folder name in the config file that would cause HUDReplacer trying to get the images from inexistent directories (effectively breaking the mod) on case-sensitive operating systems. Doesn't matter on MS Windows.


Naztheme 0.1a

  • Initial release: 5 folders, 1 cfg file, 1 README, 94 images.

 

Known "issues" and similar stuff

  • The facility icons for the Runway, the Launchpad, the VAB and the SPH in the KSC scene are completely messed up. That's normal. I'll fix it later. (yes, it's still there, and I'm too lazy to fix that apparently)
  • The look of the theme sometimes clashes (in a visual way) with the stock look (especially in flight). I told you, it's mostly a bit incomplete.
  • Not everything is supported (yet).
  • Broken in case-sensitive OS (fixed in 0.1b)
  • DeltaV button is off-centered in flight (fixed in 0.2c)
  • Action Group buttons look weird (will fix statemaps later)
  • Warp to sunrise buttons look weird (fill redo them later)

 

Edited March 3 by Nazalassa
Screenshots moved to Codeberg; Codeberg repo added

I recently discovered HUDReplacer (by @UltraJohn) which allows to change internal images in KSP, including almost all UI elements. So I'm currently creating my own theme, and since some of you may be interested in obtaining it, well... now you can obtain it

  3. Copy the directory into GameData. Please do not put it in another directory, as if you do HUDReplacer won't load the images (unless you change the config).
  4. Launch the game and enjoy!

  • Completed Kerbnet access window.

Spoiler

 

Note: the KAL editor likely won't be affected when you open it for the first time, if you have the dev edition of HUDReplacer, press 'q'. If you have the regular version, go to any other scene (tracking station, etc.) and then go back to the ship (or the VAB if it's where you were).

I really like this design! Will you be making a navball?

Also, does it work with B9 Part switch?

2 hours ago, Rutabaga22 said:

I really like this design! Will you be making a navball?

I have, um, already made that

Spoiler

although it is not yet available for download. (joke) If you want the file, you can get it here, just put it in the "flight" directory (GameData/Naztheme/Flight). Note that you have to restart KSP if you want the "normal" texture to show up. That said, the texture's 1:1, so it won't be really hard.

2 hours ago, Rutabaga22 said:

Also, does it work with B9 Part switch?

Anything that only uses stock textures will work fine (except if it uses some textures that haven't been done yet).

If, however, a mod uses its own textures, then I don't think it will work, I (or we) will have to add a bunch of, or at least some, textures to the mod. But I'll think about it when I'll have put more textures in the stock game (I'm planning to do the flight scene, and finish the AG tab in the VAB).
